title: Hide 'No data yet' in Dashboard header measurements and collapse empty row

requirements.summary: Remove the Weekly measurements fallback text so only the 'Weekly' label remains when there is no weekly data.
acceptanceCriteria: When weekly measurements contain no values > 0, the Dashboard header does not display the text "No data yet" anywhere under the "Weekly" label.
The "Weekly" label itself remains visible (unless it is intentionally hidden by REQ-3).

file_operations.description: Adjust Weekly rendering logic to not render the "No data yet" fallback when weekly measurements have no values > 0; keep the "Weekly" label visible when Monthly has data.

requirements.summary: Remove the Monthly measurements fallback text so only the 'Monthly' label remains when there is no monthly data.
acceptanceCriteria: When monthly measurements contain no values > 0, the Dashboard header does not display the text "No data yet" anywhere under the "Monthly" label.
The "Monthly" label itself remains visible (unless it is intentionally hidden by REQ-3).

file_operations.description: Adjust Monthly rendering logic to not render the "No data yet" fallback when monthly measurements have no values > 0; keep the "Monthly" label visible when Weekly has data.

requirements.summary: Collapse the Dashboard header measurements row when both Weekly and Monthly have no data so no empty gap is shown.
acceptanceCriteria: With no weekly data and no monthly data, the Dashboard does not show empty measurement containers/spacers below the header row, and the next section starts immediately after the header block with normal spacing.

file_operations.description: When both Weekly and Monthly measurements contain no values > 0, render nothing (return null) so the measurements row collapses to minimal/zero height and does not leave a placeholder gap on the Dashboard.
Ensure the header block spacing remains correct when HeaderMeasurements renders nothing (no extra spacer/gap introduced by the measurements row).
